comments.body: Isn't this shell syntax in a makefile? Does that work?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +4,8 @@# This needs to be major.minor, just "3" doesn't work - it will result in
# issues with the amendments to PYTHONPATH and install paths (see DIST_VARS).
export PYVER=`python3 -c 'import sys; print("{0}.{1}".format(*sys.version_info[:2]))'`
PYTHON = python$(PYVER)

comments.body:
Are you sure make can't handle a colon now that it's within the `$(`?

I think the previous version was just not valid syntax at all - now that you're using normal makefile assignment, I'd expect it to be ok.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@# evaluate it now to allow easier debugging when printing the varaible

PYVER:=$(shell python3 -c 'from sys import version_info as v; print("{0}.{1}".format(v[0], v[1]))')
PYTHON = python$(PYVER)

comments.body: Avoid printing exception to console if numpy not fould

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +73,77 @@DIST_VARS=SPHINXBUILD="LANG=C PYTHONPATH=$(INSTALL_PPH) python$(PYVER) `which sphinx-build`" PYTHON="PYTHONPATH=$(INSTALL_PPH) python$(PYVER)" 

NUMPYVER:=$(shell $(PYTHON) -c "import numpy; print(numpy.version.git_revision[:10])" 2>/dev/null)
GITVER ?= $(shell cd ..; $(PYTHON) -c "from setup import git_version; \
				print(git_version()[:10])")

comments.body: make error message more helpful if numpy not found

It seems the original substitution expression was for an earlier version of this Makefile, since I could not find `halt-on-error` in the `build/latex/Makefile` after running `make latex`. 

+1 for this change
